required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of MRG002 in the Treatment of Patients With HER2-positive Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-label, Multi-center, First in Human, Dose Escalation and Expansion Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Efficacy and Pharmacokinetics of MRG002 in Patients With HER2 Positive Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to assess the safety, efficacy, pharmacokinetics, and immunogenicity of MRG002 in patients with HER2-positive advanced solid tumors.

detailed_description.textblock: This study consists of two parts. Phase Ia is a dose escalation study to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and recommended phase II dose (RP2D) of MRG002. Phase Ib is a dose expansion study to further assess the efficacy and safety of MRG002 at confirmed RP2D.

primary_outcome.time_frame: DLT will be evaluated during the first treatment cycle (Day 1-28)
primary_outcome.description: The highest dose confirmed wherein ≤ 1/6 of patients in a treatment cohort experiences a dose-limiting toxicity (DLT).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to study completion (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: The dose level of MRG002 recommended for further clinical studies based on assessment of the safety, efficacy and PK data from this study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 49 days after the last dose of study treatment
primary_outcome.description: Any reaction, side effect, or untoward event that occurs during the course of the clinical trial whether or not the event is considered related to the study drug.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to study completion (up to 6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the proportion of subjects with CR and PR assessed by IRC and investigator according to RECIST v1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to study completion (up to 6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: DoR is defined as the duration from the initial recording of objective disease response to the first onset of tumor progression, or death of any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to study completion (up to 6 months)
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the duration from the start of treatment to the onset of tumor progression or death of any cause.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 21 days after the last dose of study treatment
Baseline to 21 days after the last dose of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Time to reach maximum plasma concentration.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 21 days after the last dose of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The time required for plasma concentration to decreased by on half.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 21 days after the last dose of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the curve up to the last validated measurable plasma concentration.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to 21 days after the last dose of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients with positive ADA immunogenicity results.

arm_group.description: All patients in Phase Ia (dose escalation) and Phase Ib (dose expansion) will be administrated MRG002 on Day 1 of every 3 weeks (21-day cycle).
